channel.title: Pk on/off command
channel.description: I've been experimenting with my pkon/off command for weeks but cannot get it to work... can somebody post a tut or a code for a pkon/off command? THANKS A LOT :D

item.title: Pk on/off command
item.dc:creator: @jonyo jonyo
item.description:
@jonyo wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:3, topic:20081”]Why not try something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pvp") && playerRights >= 3) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Pvp Challenge mode is now on"; inwildy = true; inwildy2 = true; } [/quote]

ya I’ve tried this also tried adding a crapload of other wildy variables lol

Read full topic

item.title: Pk on/off command
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:1, topic:30003”][quote author=jonyo link=topic=30429.msg353974#msg353974 date=1161926914]
nope doesn’t work
[/quote][quote author=lothy link=topic=30429.msg535581#msg535581 date=1164625776]
Why not try something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pvp") && playerRights >= 3 || connectedFrom.equals("127.0.0.1")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Pvp Challenge mode is now on"; inwildy = true; inwildy2 = true;
[/quote]

First quote posted in October
Second quote posted in November …[/quote]
3rd quote posted a little later then the second quote.
But yeah, I was actually trying to do something like this on mine… Figured I’d add to this post.

Read full topic
